channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Three new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand
item.description: There have been three new cases of Covid-19 confirmed in New Zealand today, with no further deaths. Watch the latest media conference live here.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 1 May
item.description: Grant Robertson has warned New Zealanders not to hold parties at home during level three, as Covid-19 can spread easily at such events. Follow all the latest news with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Three nurses caring for Auckland rest home patients have Covid-19
item.description: Three hospital workers in Auckland who cared for people infected with Covid-19 from St Margaret's Hospital and Rest Home have tested positive for the disease.

item.title: 'Contactless adoptions': Unwanted pets can be rehomed under alert level 3
item.description: Hundreds of unwanted pets are getting the chance to find new homes under alert level 3, with the SPCA now offering "contactless adoptions".

item.title: Fish and Game to be reviewed after chairperson voted out
item.description: An independent review of Fish and Game New Zealand will be carried out, the Conservation Minister has confirmed.

item.title: Genetic scientists map spread of Covid-19 in New Zealand
item.description: Genetic scientists mapping the spread of Covid-19 say that as few as 35 cases may have led to the outbreak here.

item.title: Covid-19: Prisoners confined to cells for up to 29 hours, diary shows
item.description: Women at an Auckland prison have been routinely confined to their cells for periods of up to 29 hours at a stretch - well outside the law, which says they should get at least one hour out of their cells a day.

item.title: Wild duck off the menu until alert level 2
item.description: Fish and Game rangers will be out in force this weekend to ensure duck hunters do not jump the gun and break the ban on hunting.

item.title: High-interest loan changes to better protect vulnerable families
item.description: Vulnerable families targeted by "friendly" loan sharks will be better protected, now the rules around high-interest loans have changed, the Retirement Commissioner says.

item.title: Ensuring people show up for Covid-19 testing biggest challenge - Clark
item.description: Health Minister David Clark says the biggest challenge the government faces in its response to Covid-19 is ensuring people show up for testing promptly.

item.title: Homicide investigation launched after woman dies from critical injuries in Mount Roskill
item.description: Auckland police have launched a homicide investigation after a woman was killed at a Mount Roskill property this morning.

item.title: Work visa holders stuck overseas having 'sleepless nights'
item.description: Hundreds of work visa holders on overseas trips when the border closed say they are desperate to get back to their jobs and homes in New Zealand.

item.title: Domestic violence calls to police increase in lockdown
item.description: Family harm is on the rise as women find it harder to escape their abusers during Covid-19 restrictions.

item.title: Auckland traffic pollution returns at alert level 3
item.description: Air pollution from traffic has soared to levels higher than before the level 4 lockdown in Auckland.

item.title: Man charged with kidnapping in Palmerston North
item.description: A 28-year-old man has been charged with kidnapping after a woman was left with serious injuries.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened on 30 April
item.description: It's the last day of April, and just three new cases of Covid-19 were announced in Aotearoa - a dramatically different situation to many other countries.

item.title: Disgraced police officer who raped colleague jailed for six years
item.description: A police officer who raped his female colleague as she slept has been jailed for six years.

item.title: Northland checkpoint remains with police help
item.description: An iwi roadblock north of Whangārei remains in place under level 3, with volunteers reporting huge increases in traffic.
